Job Title: Supervisor 1st Shift

Location: Litchfield Park, AZ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Description

Are you passionate about Warehouse Operations? Are you looking for an opportunity to make an impact in a global company? We need people like you to help us hire the best in the business and we're excited to have you join us in this significant role to ensure we continue to build a diverse and engaged workforce! Come be part of something special at CJ Logistics!

Warehouse Supervisor 

Position Overview:

The Warehouse Supervisor is responsible for directing and engaging operations employees in CJ Logistics center to achieve productivity goals. The Warehouse Supervisor will manage a shift and will spend most of the time coaching and leading the operations team to efficiently and safely achieve production and quality goals.The role will collaborate with various CJ Logistics’ teams on implementing continuous improvement initiatives and leading practices.

Position Responsibilities

Engage the WorkforceInteract with and motivate the workforceConduct daily shift meetingsSolve problems and address issues for employeesRegularly communicate team goals and resultsLead and engage in site activities and ESG eventsHold monthly safety meetings with the safety committee Lead and participate in site management meetings and employee round tables deliver operational Performance (including Productivity and Efficiency Targets)Understand and communicate shift, Customer and Logistics Center goalsExecute the daily work plan by adjusting the workflow to meet goalsImplement CJ Logistics’s Labor Management Program (performance observations)Participate and assist in completion of inventory and quality audits

Provide front line feedback on staffing needs to General Manager I and Warehouse Manager

Partner with leadership to coordinate supplies ordering and maintenance schedules Manage Employee Performance (including Safety, Quality and Productivity)

Provide coaching through observations and provide performance feedback

Track and communicate Forklift Operator’ performanceConduct safety observations and participate in Safety Committee 

Monitor and manage employee time, attendance and payroll

Ensure Implementation of Leading PracticesJob shadow Forklift OperatorsIdentify training and cross-training needsConduct on-the-job training with Forklift Operators Perform process quality checks and program management

Connect employees to customer business objectives

Communicate customer specific requirementsReview Logistics Center performance against Customer requirementsHelp the Forklift Operators to feel more connected to the larger customer goals

Required

Qualifications and Requirements

Bachelor’s degree1-3 years of direct supervisory experienceSkills in leadership, organization, communication and cross functional teamworkEmphasis on safety is extremely important 

Preferred

Understanding of warehousing operations with experience in a distribution and/or manufacturing environmentFamiliarity with MHEFamiliarity with Microsoft Office applications including Excel and WordFamiliarity with warehouse management systems or Red Prairie WMS is a plus

Personal Qualities

Ability shift priorities easily, and multi-task in a highly transactional environmentExcellent problem-solving skillsAbility to engage with the workforce and create a positive environment and culture

CJ Logistics about statement:

CJ Logistics delivers integrated and multimodal logistics services, connecting every corner of the world via air, sea and land. As a lead logistics partner (LLP), third-party logistics provider (3PL) and supply chain consultant, we help customers leverage supply chain management as a competitive advantage, reducing total system costs, transforming business processes, improving service and facilitating growth and change. With a focus on social responsibility and sustainability through growth with customers and communities, we prioritize the wellbeing of the end consumer, our customers and our employees. CJ Logistics is responsible for the North America region, specializing in solutions for regulated industries such as food and beverage, consumer-packaged goods, healthcare and medical supplies, and tire and automotive.

CJ Logistics is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We prohibit discrimination and or/harassment of any type, including but not limited to discrimination and or harassment based upon race, religion, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, pregnancy or relation medical conditions, childbirth, breastfeeding, parental status, veteran and/or military statue, disability (physical or mental) medical condition, genetic information or characteristics, political affiliation, domestic violence survivor status, marital status, or other characteristics prohibited by federal, state, or local law. Additionally, CJ Logistics participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations.

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
